data.Examples: Native Instrument's Reaktor, PureData, csound, Max/MSP. It
data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
OpenSoundControl (OSC) is a protocol that lets audio software talk
    to each other on a network (see
    http://www.cnmat.berkeley.edu/OpenSoundControl/ ).

    I chose the Audio namespace because it is a well-used namespace for
    all kinds of audio software and data related modules.

    OpenSound Control is a protocol that is used in various well-known
    sound synthesis programs, both commercial and non-commercial.
    Examples: Native Instrument's Reaktor, PureData, csound, Max/MSP. It
    is therefore of significant interest to the sound synthesis
    community.

    Note that I think that chapter 5 (InterProcess Communication) might
    also be appropriate.
